page.title: 10LOCAL LANDOWNERS
page.content: The present Laird of the Garden estate is Colonel James Stirling and the estate has belonged to his family for 400 years. Garden extends to approximately 4000 acres and includes 6 tenanted farms as well as 450 acres of centrally managed mixed forestry. There are presently 18 occupied cottages on the estate, but now only 3 full-time estate workers - 2 foresters and a gamekeeper. The responsibilities retained by the estate include woodlands, hedges, some fences, cottage maintenance, some farm buildings and drainage on some parts of the estate. (Details of the estate farms on subsequent pages.) Col Stirling is Lord Lieutenant and Chairman of the Highland Territorial Volunteer Reserve Association.
